TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and is currently serving his sentence in FAC . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
CARDINAL . NORP The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and placed in a short - term detention facility in ORG .
CARDINAL . The applicant remained in that facility for the following periods :

CARDINAL . According to the applicant , the conditions in that detention facility were inhuman and degrading on several accounts . There was no daylight , no toilet , no access to water and no ventilation . He had to sleep on the concrete floor without a mattress or blanket . The cell was damp , and was infested with insects .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , he was not able to correspond with his relatives while in that detention facility .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained about the conditions of his detention to ORG . On DATE they replied that they were not in a position to ensure better conditions for detainees .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG that he was not allowed to correspond with his relatives . On DATE they replied that private correspondence was not allowed .
CARDINAL . The relevant laws have been summarised in PERSON v. GPE ( dec . ) , ( no . CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE , and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .

CARDINAL . Since the entry into force of the new LAW GPE likums ) on DATE several normative acts concerning detention have been adopted . Initially , the ORG passed a law on procedure for keeping detainees in short - term detention facilities in police departments ( ORG personu turēšanas kārtības likums ) ; it does not specify if detainees held in those facilities have the right of correspondence . After that the ORG issued a regulation that was later replaced by another law ( PERSON turēšanas kārtības likums ) applicable to detainees held in investigative wings of prisons and to detainees held in the short - term detention facilities in police departments . The law expressly provides for the right of correspondence .

CARDINAL . In addition , section DATE of LAW provides that every wrongful act as a result of which damage has been suffered shall give the victim the right to claim compensation from the perpetrator , in so far as he or she may be held culpable for that act . The later amendments to that law , which took effect on DATE , expressly specify that it includes non - pecuniary damage .
